sen.e: Seyaku-in (Pharmacy Institution), which was established in the Nara period as Ryogenokan (extra statutory office), was a rescue facility for common people as well as a medical plant garden.

sen.j: 施薬院（せやくいん）は、聖徳太子が仏教の慈悲の思想に基づき、その地に薬草を栽培し、怪我や病気で苦しむ人を救うために四天王寺内に作ったと言われる施設。
sen.e: Seyaku-in was a facility, which Prince Shotoku, based on the Buddhism philosophy of mercy, had allegedly erected inside of the Shitenno-ji Temple territory where medical herbs were cultivated to relieve people suffering from injury or diseases.

sen.e: Tradition has it that in 593 when the Prince Shotoku erected Shitenno-ji Temple in Osaka, which was the oldest kanji (state-sponsored temples) of Japan, he erected the Seyaku-in as one of the Shikain (four institutions) which included Hiden-in, Keiden-in, Ryobyoin, and Seyaku-in.
